articles.title: Men face 'almost three times the odds' of ICU admission for Covid-19, study says - CNN
articles.description: A global analysis of over 3 million coronavirus cases has found that male patients with Covid-19 are almost three times more likely to require admission to intensive care than female patients.

articles.author: Amanda Macias
articles.title: Pentagon reveals plans to distribute first 44,000 doses of Pfizer vaccine as early as next week - CNBC
articles.description: As early as next week, the Department of Defense is slated to receive nearly 44,000 of the first dose of Pfizer's coronavirus vaccine.
articles.content: WASHINGTON  The Pentagon outlined Wednesday its initial steps of the agency's plan to distribute and administer Pfizer's coronavirus vaccine to the more than 2 million active duty, reserve and civili… [+2271 chars]

articles.author: Andrea Michelson
articles.title: Nurse in COVID-19 vaccine trial: Side effects were bad but worth it - Business Insider - Business Insider
articles.description: Kristen Choi had a high fever, nausea, and fatigue after her second shot, but the effects subsided. She said getting the shot was worth it.
articles.content:
A couple of hours after getting her second shot in a trial of Pfizer and BioNTech's coronavirus vaccine in September, Kristen Choi felt chilled, nauseous, and light-headed.
Choi hadn't experienced a… [+4870 chars]

articles.author: Emma Reynolds, Sharon Braithwaite and Amy Cassidy, CNN
articles.title: Allergy warning for Pfizer/BioNTech vaccine after UK health workers with allergy history suffer reaction - CNN
articles.description: People with a "significant history of allergic reactions" should not be given the Pfizer/BioNTech coronavirus vaccine, UK health authorities said Wednesday, after two healthcare workers had symptoms after receiving a shot the day before.

articles.author: Sharon LaFraniere, Katie Thomas, Noah Weiland
articles.title: Trump administration officials passed when Pfizer offered months ago to sell the U.S. more vaccine doses. - The New York Times
